As a guest of Spectrum Resort Orlando, you’re just steps away from the fun and relaxation of the Reunion Resort Water Park. Conveniently located right next door, it offers the perfect combination of family-friendly excitement and peaceful poolside comfort. With splash zones, winding water slides, a lazy river, and plenty of places to relax, it’s an easy and enjoyable way to spend the day without leaving the resort. Lazy River Settle into a complimentary tube and enjoy a peaceful ride along the winding 1000 foot lazy river. As you glide past gentle waterfalls and drift beneath the towering waterslide, the calm atmosphere invites you to slow down and take in the lush surroundings. It’s a perfect way to relax, reconnect with loved ones, and enjoy the warmth of the Florida sun at your own pace. Water Slide For a splash of excitement, head to the waterslide nestled right within the heart of the Water Park. With smooth curves and a quick descent, it’s just the right balance of fun and refreshment. Kids love the ride, and adults often find themselves joining in for one more go. Easy to access and designed for all-day enjoyment, the slide adds a playful touch to an otherwise relaxing setting. Aquatic Playground This vibrant, island-inspired play area is full of interactive fun. Kids can dart through gentle spray zones, climb across rope bridges, and dodge bursts from playful water cannons. Every few minutes, the excitement builds as a giant bucket fills and tips, sending a refreshing splash over the entire structure. It’s an energetic centerpiece made for nonstop family fun. Fun Pool Games Just steps from the pool, guests can take a break from the water and join in on a variety of classic lawn and poolside games. From friendly rounds of ping pong and corn hole to hula hoop challenges, relay races, and oversized Connect Four, there’s something for every age and energy level. Private Cabanas Soak up some sun or relax in your private, shaded retreat. The tranquil poolside cabanas are the embodiment of serenity. Learn More Reunion Resort Pools In addition to Spectrum’s private pool located at our clubhouse, guests also have full access to four additional pools located throughout Reunion Resort. Each one offers its own atmosphere, perfect for seeking a peaceful morning dip, a spot to unwind with a good book, or space for the whole family to splash and play. You’re never far from the perfect place to relax, refresh, and enjoy the moment. IAGTO.com - New ownership & operator at Reunion Resort & Golf Club Press Releases Join IGTWA Approved Media Golf Tourism Awards New ownership & operator at Reunion Resort & Golf Club 28 May 2019 Reunion Resort & Golf Club has a boost of golf business with the 3 designer golf courses in one majestic and breathtaking resort under New Owner & Operator. New Ownership adds to the portfolio of Reunion Resort & Golf Club, 3 more offerings for the golfer located in Crystal River, FL and Ashasta and Clayton, GA. Please, visit www.KingwoodInternationalResorts.com Media Contact: Rochelle Siegel, Hayworth PR (386) 677-7000 x 7 rochelle@hayworthpr.com Kingwood International Resorts Acquires Reunion Resort in Central Florida ATLANTA (Feb. 8, 2019) – Kingwood International Resorts has purchased the AAA Four Diamond-rated Reunion Resort, located on 2,300 lush acres in Central Florida, just minutes from Walt Disney World theme parks. Specializing in golf-centered clubs and resorts, Atlanta-based Kingwood International currently owns and operates Kingwood Country Club & Golf Resort and Achasta Golf Resort community, both in North Georgia, and the eco-friendly Plantation on Crystal River in Central West Florida. The purchase of Reunion Resort from real estate investment firm Lubert Adler was finalized Friday, Feb. 8. “Reunion Resort is a perfect complement to our portfolio of upscale golf communities and resorts,” stated Richard Nasser, president of the Resort Division of Kingwood International Resorts. “With its varied accommodation options, world-class golf and exceptional amenities, Reunion is known as an ideal resort for guests who want to experience everything Orlando has to offer. Our goal is to enhance the guest experience at every turn and drive awareness to the next level.” Kingwood International has plans to make significant investments in Reunion Resort, such as the addition of 1,200 rental accommodations, including a new 400-room hotel with significant convention and meeting facilities to enhance the resort’s condominium and private home rentals. There will also be an expansion of the multi-acre Reunion Resort Water Park, with the addition of a wave pool, new water slide, putt-putt golf and a larger, covered food and beverage offering. Kingwood will enact growth initiatives for Reunion’s Club membership as well, including expanded benefits to add exclusivity and value. “We are excited to add Reunion Resort as a key acquisition in our growth strategy for Kingwood International Resorts,” stated Fred Zohouri, Kingwood’s founder and chief executive. “Our plan is to build upon the successes of Reunion’s leadership and frontline hospitality professionals so we can provide our members and guests with extraordinary experiences.” Reunion Resort features 360 resort-style accommodations ranging from luxury multi-room villas to private three- to 13-bedroom vacation homes, as well as 25,000 square feet of meeting and event space. Widely recognized as a top golf destination, Reunion is the only location in the world featuring three signature championship golf courses designed by golfing legends Jack Nicklaus, Arnold Palmer and Tom Watson. Amenities at the resort include seven casual and fine dining venues, including an award-winning rooftop steakhouse, elegant indoor and outdoor meeting space, six hydro-grid clay tennis courts, a full-service boutique spa, 10 community pools, fitness center and a five-acre waterpark. For more information on Reunion Resort, visit ReunionResort.com. For information on Kingwood International Resorts, visit KingwoodInternationalResorts.com. Reunion Resort Water Park Time to splash in! Reunion Resort Water Park is Reunion’s top amenity destination for guests staying within Reunion Resort. Spread out across five acres of land lies a cluster of thrilling slides, water activities, relaxing lazy rivers, and appetizing dining options for guests to enjoy. Throw on your favorite swimsuits and enjoy the various water activities throughout the water park. From twisty water slides that children and adults alike can enjoy to unwinding as you float down the lazy river, there’s something for everyone to love. Guests can also revel in the zero-entry pool or journey over to the on-site splash pad for the little ones to play at. With so much to do here, you can easily make this single activity part of your entire vacation day. After having a blast in the water, take to the nearby games for extra fun at the water park. Choose from ping pong, billiards, ladder ball, foosball, giant chess, corn hole, and even hula hoop activities. It’s another exciting way to get the most out of your Water Park experience. Guests can enhance their visit to Reunion Resort Water Park by renting one of the private cabanas. Give yourself and your family ultimate relaxation and tranquility with a shaded cabana that not only protects you from the sun but your belongings as well. Please see the Water Park front desk for more information on how to rent your private cabana. With all of the energy used during your exciting day at the Water Park, wind down with a mouthwatering meal or refreshing drink from The Grill at the Water Park. Choose from a list of refreshing signature cocktails, like Coastal Paloma or The Floridian Way, or take a swig at the assortment of beer, wine, and other frozen beverage options. And for the grumbles in your stomach, satisfy your hunger with The Grill’s choice of sandwiches, salads, flatbreads, and family-style baskets. Nothing completes a day at the Water Park better than a meal you can truly enjoy. With so much to do and so little time, make sure to add Reunion® Resort Water Park to your thrilling Orlando vacation itinerary. For Water Park hours, please contact the Water Park front desk at (407) 396-3048. Hours vary by season. Our Address Reunion Rentals 7549 Osceola Polk Line Rd. Getaway to Fairway Reunion Resort Your Family-Friendly Resort Destination Located in Central Florida just minutes from Walt Disney World®, Reunion Resort & Golf Club is your premier Orlando vacation destination. Enjoy luxury villa accommodations and vacation homes, three championship golf courses by Palmer, Watson, and Nicklaus, a 5-acre water park, tennis and pickleball, mini golf, and exceptional on-site dining. Whether for a family vacation, golf getaway, or group retreat, Reunion Resort delivers the best in Florida resort experiences. Designed by legends Arnold Palmer Legacy Course This 6,916-yard course features dramatic elevation changes of up to 50 feet, offering golfers a thrilling risk-reward experience across hilly, rolling terrain. Learn More Designed by legends Tom Watson Independence Course This 7,154-yard course challenges golfers with wide-open greens, rolling fairways, and strategically placed bunkers that demand a solid short game. Learn More Designed by legends Jack Nicklaus Tradition Course Designed with smooth, flowing horizon lines and elevated tee boxes and greens, this course tests golfers with its thoughtful layout that rewards precision. View the calendar at: reunionresort.com/event-calendar Access & Admission • Reunion Waterpark is private; guests cannot pay at the gate • Admission requires one of the following plus photo ID : Reunion Resort wristband, Wyndham wristband, or Reunion Resort Membership card • Amenity wristbands must be obtained at the Grande front desk (7593 Gatherings Drive) before entering • Wyndham guests can purchase one-day wristbands (waterpark access only) for $40 Basics & Rules • Towels: One complimentary towel per guest (must be returned upon departure) • Cabanas: 14 available daily—reserve by calling 407‑396‑3048 • Inner tubes: Complimentary on the lazy river; personal tubes allowed if full‑size acceptable • Swim diapers: Required for potty‑training children; available for purchase • Retail shop: Located at the waterpark front desk, sells sunscreen, swim diapers, goggles, floatation aids, phone cases, sand toys, and more • No coolers or outside food/beverages allowed—but guests may bring bottled water (still or sparkling), fruit, and baby food/milk • No glass containers; all bags are subject to inspection • Alcohol violations may result in waterpark privileges being revoked Capacity & Access Policies • Maximum capacity: 500 guests; admissions paused at capacity • Cabanas booked in advance guarantee park access even at full capacity Pool & Slide Info • Pool/lazy river depth: 3–4 ft • Volcano Twist waterslide: Minimum height 42″ • Kid splash zone: Two small slides for children under 50″ Supervision Requirements • Children 12 & under must be accompanied by an adult at all times • No one under 16 admitted without a parent/guardian • Teens aged 16 may not supervise younger guests—adult 18+ required Staff & Conduct • No lifeguards on duty (park is monitored by security) • Aggressive or hostile behavior (verbal or physical) results in the removal and revocation of privileges Exclusive Areas • Longboards: Private deck reserved for Reunion Members only (no access for Wyndham guests) Weather & Seasonal Operations • Open year-round; water features close only for severe weather • Lightning within 6 miles temporarily closes water features—guests may remain in the park and enjoy non-water amenities • Additional closure triggers include freezing temperatures, tropical storms or hurricanes, high winds, or extreme heat index Attractions Aquatic Playground With spraying water cannons, rope bridges, water sprays, and a giant water bucket that empties every few minutes, our tropically-themed Water Park is undeniably the hub of family activity at Reunion Resort. Attractions Lazy River & Waterslide Take a relaxing ride in our complimentary tubes along our long lazy river passing by waterfalls and under the water slide. Attractions Pool Games Adjacent to the pool area at the Water Park, you’ll find plenty of opportunity for games such as ping pong, hula hoop games, relay races, corn hole, and giant Connect Four. Attractions Surrey Bike Rentals Rent a surrey bike to explore the Reunion Resort property. To make reservations or ask questions, please call our Water Park Front Desk at 407.396.3048 or email mbenjamin@reunionresort.com . Surrey Bike Rentals Surrey Bike Rentals Rent a bicycle or surrey bike to explore the Reunion Resort property. To make reservations or ask questions, please call our Water Park Front Desk at 407.396.3048 or email mbenjamin@reunionresort.com . For surrey bike rentals, guests must be 18 years of age or older to drive. In addition, guests must be 58 inches or taller to be in a pedaling position. For all bike rentals, riders must wear closed-toed shoes. (No flip flops, bare feet or open-toed shoes, please.) Rentals begin at 10 a.m. and end at 6 p.m. Surrey Bike Rentals Single Bench: $25 for 30 minutes. The single-bench surrey can accommodate two people on the bench and two children in the front child seat. Double Bench: $30 for 30 minutes. The double-bench surrey can accommodate four people on the benches and two children in the front child seat. Drifters Grille Food & Drink Refuel your day at one of the best waterparks in Orlando with sharable snacks and kid-friendly favorites, and cool off with refreshing frozen drinks and cocktails from Drifters Grille. Orders are available for pick up at the Food Truck. Visit our Guest Calendar for most up to date hours of operation. View Menu Cabana Rentals Cabana Rentals Rent Your Private Water Park Cabana Today! Cabana rentals are the most comfortable way to enjoy our Water Park. Rentals are by the day and include a s haded hut with fan, two personal Cabana lazy river tubes, Aloha bar and food service, complimentary water, two lounge chairs, and a sofa that sits four adults with tables. To learn more or book a cabana, please call our Water Park Front Desk (only open the hours of the Water Park) at 407.396.3048 or email mbenjamin@reunionresort.com . Read More 1. Cabanas are full day rentals (park open to close), no half days. 2 hours is considered time spent in the cabana and no refunds will be issues if guests choose to not spend the whole day. 2. Guests will receive a full refund if they cancel by 10am the day of their reservation. 3. No refund will be issues to guests who do not call by 10am or do not show for their reservations. 4. If Florida weather causes a guest to want to leave and they have spent less than 2 hours in cabana, guests will receive a 50% refund. Gallery people sitting by the pool enjoying the sun water fall at the water park little boy having fun in splash pad Water Park Policies Inclement Weather For the safety of our guests and employees, operating hours for all amenities at Reunion Resort & Golf Club are subject to change and may be adjusted without prior notice due to weather conditions or other unforeseen circumstances. Dangerous weather may include, but is not limited to, thunder and lightning, rain, high winds, hail, hurricanes, tornadoes, or extreme heat. Please note that no compensation, refunds, or credits will be provided for amenity closures or limited access resulting from inclement weather. We appreciate your understanding and cooperation. Access to the Water Park Reunion Waterpark is a Private Waterpark for Reunion Resort guests and Reunion Resort Partners. If you have booked your stay directly through Reunion Resort, WorldMark by Wyndham, our Preferred Partners (Magical Vacation Homes, Jeeves Florida Vacation Homes, Florida Vacation Homes, Rentyl Resorts), or you are a Member, you can play at the Water Park every day of your visit. If you’ve booked through a third-party vendor, you will not have access to the water park. Encore Resort guests and members do not have access to the Water Park. Keep Your Wristbands Handy Member & Houseguest Wristbands and Amenity Access Wristbands are required for admission. Guest Rules The number of daily passes granted to your party for access to the water park is determined by the maximum occupancy of your unit. For example, if the maximum occupancy of your villa is 3 guests, you will be given up to 3 daily passes to the water park. Registered Houseguests may not have any accompanied guests of their own. Members must accompany their guests at all times in the waterpark at all times. Platinum Members can bring 8 (complimentary) guests per day and Gold Members can bring 4 (complimentary) guests per day! Both Platinum and Gold Membership can pay for an additional 4 guests for the day at $15 each. Children cannot be dropped off at the Water Park. Those under the age of 16 must be accompanied by an adult 18 years or older. The Water Park is not open to the public. Guests must be a minimum of 42” to ride the main slide. Guests must be a minimum of 30lbs to a maximum weight of 280lbs to utilize the slide. Reunion Resort Waterpark is a private waterpark. Any inappropriate or aggressive behavior can result in removal from the park for the remainder of your stay. Max Occupancy The Water Park occupancy is 500 islanders. Once the Water Park reaches max occupancy, additional guests will not be let in until other guests leave. Guests who have booked a cabana will be granted access even when the Water Park is at capacity. Other Tips No outside food or beverage is permitted in the Water Park which means no coolers. However, Guests are allowed to bring bottled water, sparkling water, or fruit for hydration into the park. T umblers, jugs, and large cups are permitted, but they must be empty when entering. Complimentary water and ice stations are available inside the Water Park. Baby food/milk is allowed. No Glass containers are permitted due to safety concerns for our other resort guests. Food for children under the age of 2 is permitted. Keep all pool towels in the Water Park area at all times. For the comfort of all, no smoking is allowed. The waterpark does sell sunscreen and other poolside favorites. All bags entering the park will require a bag check. If you do not feel comfortable having your bag checked, please leave it at your villa. If you have any additional questions about Reunion Resort’s Water Park, check out our FAQ page or call us at 407.396.3048 . We can’t wait to see you! Seasonality Reunion Water Park is open year round, 7 days a week. Hours may vary seasonally at the Water Park. Please refer to our "Reunion Water Park Status Hotline" to have the most up to date information on the hours of operations and opening and closures due to weather. The hotline's number is 407.396.3758 . Some features at the Water Park may not be open or available. This may change daily due to necessary maintenance needs. Height Requirements While the largest slide requires guests to be 42 inches to ride, you’ll find that most of the Water Park’s features at Reunion Resort are suitable for kids of all ages.  Maximum pool depth is 4ft. so no diving is permitted. The water slide is single rider - small children cannot ride on their parent's lap. G uests must be a minimum of 30lbs to maximum weight of 280lbs to utilize the slide. Children who are not yet potty-trained should wear swim diapers while in the pool. Water Park Attire The Reunion Resort Water Park is a family experience for all ages, so we ask that all guests wear appropriate swim attire throughout their visit, such as full coverage tops. No bathing suit thongs or offensive clothing are permitted. Lawn Chairs and Umbrellas At no charge, lawn chairs and umbrellas are available every day on a first-come, first-served basis. Water Temperature In cool weather, for your comfort, the water at our Water Park (and in all of our pools) is heated to approximately 10 degrees warmer than the outside air. Towels and Life Jackets Towels are available at the Water Park front desk when you check-in, guests will be limited to 1 towel per person. While there are no towels provided at the other resort pools, each villa and rental home has pool towels that you may bring to the pools. We recommend parents bring their own swim floaties to the park. We do not provide any type of life jacket or life vest, but we do have floatation devices to purchase at the parents discretion.  All children must remain in adult supervision at all times. Water Park does not have lifeguards on duty. Guests can bring their own tubes to float in the lazy river, as long as they are a reasonable size. Surrey Bike Rentals Rent a surrey bike to explore the Reunion Resort property. To make reservations or ask questions, please call our Water Park Front Desk at 407.396.3048 . For surrey bike rentals, guests must be 18 years of age or older to drive. In addition, guests must be 58 inches or taller to be in a pedaling position. For all bike rentals, riders must wear closed-toed shoes. (No flip flops, bare feet or open-toed shoes, please.) Rentals begin at 10 a.m. and end at 6 p.m. Surrey Bike Rentals Single Bench: $25 for 30 minutes. The single-bench surrey can accommodate two people on the bench and two children in the front child seat. Double Bench: $30 for 30 minutes. The double-bench surrey can accommodate four people on the benches and two children in the front child seat. Learn More Water Park FAQ Are there any height requirements Guests must be at least 48 inches tall to ride water slides. Splashers, our children’s pool play area, is designed for guests under 48 inches tall. Do you have a childrens area in the water park? Splashers, our children’s pool play area, is designed for guests under 48 inches tall. Do I need a wristband? Wristbands are required to enter the water park. Only guests renting through licensed rental companies will be able to obtain wristbands. Can I bring outside food and beverages? No outside food and beverage is permitted inside the water park. Are lockers available? Lockers are available for rent to secure personal items. Should I wear specific footwear? Sandals or water shoes are highly recommended for all water park guests. Can I bring scooters, skateboards, or bikes? All scooters, skateboards, bikes, and similar items must stay outside the gates of the water park. What if I forget something like sunscreen or a swimsuit? Our sundries shop at the water park carries sunscreen, towels, swimsuits, children’s floating devices, and much more. Are cabanas available? Cabanas are available upon request and can be reserved in advance on the cabana page. Are there spa services or dining options in the cabanas? Yes, spa services and dining options are available in the cabanas. Please ask us for a list of available services. What rules do I need to follow? For your safety and the safety of other guests, please follow all posted Encore Water Park rules. (July 23, 2020) – Reunion Resort & Golf Club, a full-service resort in Central Florida, has announced the opening of 7593 Chophouse, the resort’s newest fine-dining restaurant. Located on the main floor of the Grande building, just off resort’s elegant lobby, 7593 Chophouse serves an inspired menu of signature steaks, entrees and other chophouse cuts, and a sophisticated wine list. The restaurant’s culinary team is led by Executive Chef Sabrina Greene. “The name is derived from the resort’s street address – 7593 Gathering Drive – but I noticed another connection that is more my style,” said Chef Greene. “The new chophouse features seven amazing sides, five savory enhancements, nine perfectly selected proteins, and three signature sushi rolls – 7593. And with our great selection of hand-crafted cocktails and select wines, it adds up to the perfect dining experience.” Carefully shaped under Chef Greene’s direction, the menu features starters such as ceviche, crispy pork belly, and an artisanal charcuterie board, as well as hand-rolled sushi and extravagant salads. Catering to fans of Eleven, the resort’s popular steakhouse, which was closed earlier this year, the menu showcases USDA Prime steaks – from a New York Strip and 22 oz. bone-in Cowboy Ribeye, to double bone Elk Chops and the 48 oz. Tomahawk Steak for two. “While there are other dining options at Reunion, the new 7593 Chophouse fills a fine-dining void created when we closed Eleven,” said GM Anthony Carll. “We continue to reimagine every aspect of the resort, including our restaurants, to deliver the most exceptional experience possible for our guests.” Adding an extra touch to the steaks and other cuts, the menu includes seven house-made toppings, including au poivre sauce, bordelaise sauce, creamy horseradish, chimichurri sauce, signature steak sauce, crab Oscar and colossal grilled shrimp. Other main entrees include ossobuco, bouillabaisse and chicken & biscuits, to name a few. Signature sides include lobster mac & cheese, truffle fries and duck fat roasted fingerlings, as well as crispy brussels sprouts, poutine tater tots, baked potato, and a sauté mushroom medley. To accompany their meal, guests can choose from a collection of celebrity-themed cocktails named for notable personalities who were known to have enjoyed a round (or two) of golf and who can be seen adorning the restaurant’s walls – Dean Martini, JFK Cape Codder, Hepburn Toast and Ole Babe Ruth, among others. The restaurant’s visible wine cellar also holds an extensive and intriguing collection of international and domestic reds, whites, and sparkling pours. Crisp white linens, leather furniture and fine dinnerware provide a sense of elegance at 7593 Chophouse, while airy ceilings, oversized windows and lush landscaping outdoors offer a relaxed and welcoming feel. While the venue can accommodate up to 104 guests, the restaurant is operating at a limited capacity to meet current social distancing protocols. The private Palmer Room can seat 16 guests, with seating for 10 in the semi-private Watson Room. 7593 Chophouse is open on Friday and Saturday evenings from 5 to 10 p.m. Reservations are required, and available on Open Table. Other dining venues currently open at Reunion Resort include, the Clubhouse and Grande Lobby Sushi Bar. For more information on 7593 Chophouse, visit ReunionResort.com . Read More Reunion® Resort Nearing Completion of Extensive Golf Course Enhancement Project Reunion® Resort Nearing Completion of Extensive Golf Course Enhancement Project ORLANDO, FLA. (Sept. 16, 2019) – Reunion® Resort & Golf Club is nearing completion of an extensive renovation project encompassing all three of its signature courses. Started in May 2019, the $800,000 enhancement includes complete upgrades to bunkers and landscaping across all greens and is scheduled to be complete this fall. All courses have remained open throughout the project. “We are continuously improving the resort experience here at Reunion and our world-class golf courses were the next project on the list,” stated property General Manager Kevin Baker. “Our popular courses haven’t seen this scale of renovation since the early days of LPGA tournaments at our complex.” The project is being overseen by Florida-based ONEGOLF, Inc., which boasts an impressive 20-year track record in golf construction on courses from the Bahamas to South Korea. The enhancements at Reunion include a robust landscaping design and upgrades to drainage lines and bunkers to prevent washouts and damage to the fairways. The Nicklaus course portion of the project is unique due to the nature of the subsoil on which the course was built. New bunker liners will create a barrier between the course’s clay and sand mixture and bunker sand to help prevent contamination. The Reunion team has also been working with the Nicklaus design team to reduce the size of the bunkers to improve playability and allow for more efficient maintenance. Work on the Arnold Palmer course is complete, with only a few bunkers remaining on Jack Nicklaus, and renovations to the Tom Watson course are expected to be completed by October. “Response from our members and guests so far has been overwhelmingly positive,” stated Baker. “They notice the improvement to the look and play of the courses and are pleased with the end result.” Recognized by Golf Digest (2018) as one of only six of the “Best Golf Resorts in Florida,” Reunion’s three courses offer something unique during each round. Designed by legendary greats, the courses are of championship level with recent enhancements taking them to the next level of experience. Known for its Parkland-style smooth and flowing layout, the Jack Nicklaus course is as deceptive as it is beautiful, with long horizon lines and elevated tee boxes and greens. Highlighted by fast, firm and wide-rolling fairways, the 7,154-yard, par-72 Tom Watson course is as much about strategy as it is about length. And, at the 6,916-yard, par-72 Arnold Palmer course, players experience rollercoaster-like terrain where dramatic elevation changes – some up to 50 feet in places – create a unique variety of risk/reward shots. In addition to the three signature golf courses, guests at Reunion Resort enjoy an array of amenities, including six hydro-grid clay tennis courts, a five-acre waterpark, 10 community pools, a full-service boutique spa, and seven casual and fine-dining venues. The property features 360 resort-style accommodations ranging from luxury multi-room Villas to three- to 13-bedroom vacation homes and was named a 2019 AAA Inspector’s “Best of” Housekeeping hotel. Read More New Clubhouse at Reunion® Resort’s Nicklaus Course Opens New Clubhouse at Reunion® Resort’s Nicklaus Course Opens ORLANDO, FL (Dec. 4, 2018) – Reunion® has opened a stunning new clubhouse at its Signature Design Nicklaus Course. Located on over three acres, the new 12,000 square-foot clubhouse features panoramic views of the course and includes a state-of-the-art fitness center, men’s and women’s locker rooms and showers, a golf lifestyle retail space, an event lawn for group functions and special events, and an upscale sports bar called “Traditions,” complete with an open kitchen and outdoor terrace with views of the 18th green. A tribute to Jack Nicklaus’ masterful layout, the new clubhouse includes furnishings, artwork and memorabilia related to Nicklaus’ decorated career. “We are confident that every member and guest will enjoy this distinctive golf experience,” says Reunion Resort’s General Manager Kevin Baker. “It is always our desire to provide the best in service, facilities and playing conditions. This clubhouse provides an intimate and refreshing location to gather with family and friends, or share the triumphs of a day of championship golf at Reunion.” The new clubhouse is part of a multi-pronged improvement plan at the Nicklaus Course. Before the construction of the clubhouse began, the 17th and 18th holes were re-routed to elevate the finishing experience. Significant bunker improvement work has just been completed, while several spectacular homes have now been built in the surrounding Bear’s Den community – creating a true enclave for golfers. The clubhouse was inspired by the rich heritage of Mediterranean Revival architecture in Florida and in particular the work of Addison Mizner. It features large French doors opening to terraces with dark wood roof overhangs. The roof is shaped with barrel tiles and walls of rough stucco that provide depth and texture, along with ornamental ironwork and cast stone window frames. The interior design is characterized by rich woods and contrasting light walls, textural fabrics, and natural earthy colors such as olive, terracotta, and soft blues. The restaurant floor mimics terracotta tiles found in Mediterranean manors, while the rich millwork with iron metal detailing and beamed ceilings ensures each guest feels a luxurious sense of place. The clubhouse’s dining experience is an upscale sports bar called Traditions. Serving American regional cuisine, the menu is seasonal and local with farm-to-table elements. The bar includes a signature drink menu, including craft cocktails and signature barrel-aged bourbons. The open-air kitchen and service style is designed to be friendly and welcoming, appealing to both members and the local community. On weekends, Traditions offers live musical entertainment making it a perfect gathering place for celebrations large or small. All of the doors to the dining terrace, which overlooks the 18th green, open to allow the entire restaurant to enjoy an afternoon breeze during nice weather months. Opened in 2006, The Nicklaus Course was designed to flow smoothly and gently from tee to green. A target, parkland-style course, it was designed to be a player’s course rather than what is referred to as “resort golf.” While the 7,244-yard layout is not exceptionally long by today’s standards, postage-stamp greens, forced carries that lead to fairway targets sometimes only 50 yards wide and a fair amount of trouble for wayward shots give the course plenty of bite. The Nicklaus Course remained open throughout the Clubhouse construction process. Additionally, Reunion’s two other Signature layouts, the Watson and Palmer Courses, also continued to accommodate guest and member play. Reunion Resort features 360 resort-style accommodations ranging from luxury suites and condos to multi-room villas and private 3-to-13-bedroom vacation homes. Recognized as a top golf destination, Reunion is the only location in the world featuring three signature championship golf courses designed by golf’s greatest legends: Jack Nicklaus, Arnold Palmer, and Tom Watson. The amenity-rich resort also features eight casual and fine dining options including an award-winning rooftop steakhouse, elegant indoor and outdoor meeting spaces, six hydro-grid clay tennis courts, a full-service boutique spa, 10 community pools, and a 5-acre waterpark including slides, a water playground, and a 1,000-ft. lazy river. With various real estate and membership opportunities available, guests can stay for a weekend or become members for life. Vacation is about relaxing and having fun, and that’s so much easier when you have more space and amenities. At Reunion® Resort & Golf Club, all of our accommodations have kitchens and living areas, providing comfort and convenience when you need it. Plus, you can take advantage of all of the amenities we have to offer, including restaurants, 8 pools, water park, tennis courts, mini golf, pickleball,  golf courses, and much more. Why should I book a vacation home from Reunion® Resort rather than from a third-party rental company? Booking a home through Reunion® Resort & Golf Club ensures that you will have full and unlimited access to all of our wonderful amenities, such as our Water Park and Signature golf courses. If you are considering renting from a third-party company, please be aware that your access to amenities and services at Reunion may be quite limited. The only exception to this is Reunion Resort’s Preferred Rental Partners homes that have approved amenity access - Jeeves, Magical Vacation Homes, Rentyl and Florida Vacation Homes. Booking through Reunion Resort directly or its Preferred Rental Partners ensures that you will have access to all of our on-site amenities. How much is parking? Resort parking is $20 (plus tax) per day per unit. Reunion Resort does not provide RV, boat, or trailer parking. Valet parking is not currently offered. Do you charge a resort fee? A daily resort fee of $40 (plus tax) will be charged to your nightly room rate. Resort fees may vary with larger vacation homes. See below for many of the resort fee perks: WiFi internet access Access to three Signature Golf Courses & Tennis Centre* Water Park access with floats, lounge chairs, and umbrellas Access to 8 pools throughout the resort Access to play Pickleball, Footgolf, Bocce Ball* Access to rent Bicycles for use at the resort* Ability to rent Golf Carts for use at the resort* Children's Playgrounds Access to Putting green and driving range Access to resort Fitness Center Access to self-service Business Station *Amenities listed with (*) require additional fees for use. What transportation options are available to and from Reunion® Resort and Orlando International Airport or Orlando Sanford International Airport? At this time, Reunion® doesn’t offer transportation from Orlando International Airport or Orlando Sanford International Airport. However, many car rental and rideshare options are available. Be sure to call our Guest Services Team at (407) 662-1000 if you have questions we can assist with. How do I book a family reunion at Reunion® Resort? If you are coming with a small group, booking several villas or homes (or even one or two of our larger homes, some of which have up to 13 bedrooms) may be perfect for you. If you plan to book five villas or homes or less, please contact our Reservations Team at (833) 258-0472 . If your group is larger than five villas or homes, please call our Sales team at 407-396-5242 or send an inquiry via email at inquiries@reunionresort.com. How can I purchase a gift card? You can purchase a gift card by submitting a form here: https://www.reunionresort.com/gift-cards . We will be celebrating a special occasion. Can your staff help plan something special for us? We would love to help plan something to make your stay extra special! Please contact Guest Services at (407) 662-1000 . Resort Policies How can I protect my trip with Travel Insurance? We highly recommend you protect your trip with Travel Insurance. Travel Insurance provides coverage for personal risks and expenses incidental to planned travel, including one or more of the following: Hurricane, Interruption, delay, or cancellation of a Planned Covered Trip. Loss of or damage to baggage, luggage, or personal effects during a Planned Covered Trip. Injury, illness, accident, disability, or death occurring during a Planned Covered Trip. Click here to learn more and get a quote! If I need to cancel or change my reservation, can you accommodate my request? It may be possible to cancel or change your reservation, however, individual reservations vary greatly. Please call our Reservations number at (833) 258-0472 for assistance. Reservations must be secured by a valid credit card issued by American Express, Discover, Master Card or Visa. What type of payment methods does Reunion Resort accept? Reunion Resort is a cashless resort; all reservations and purchases throughout our property must be secured by a valid credit card issued by American Express, Discover, Master Card or Visa. What are the cancellation Policies for Reunion Resort? For Reunion Villas , one night’s room and tax is due at time of reservation confirmation and will be automatically charged to the credit card on file.  Remaining balance is due at time of arrival. Reservation must be cancelled 72 hours prior to arrival to avoid deposit’s forfeiture.  If booking less than 72 hours from arrival, the deposit will be non-refundable. Nightly resort fee of $40.00 plus tax will apply. Self-Parking is $20.00. For Vacation Rental Home & Villas , For direct bookings, A deposit of 20% of the total stay amount (including taxes and service fees) is due at the time of reservation confirmation. The reservation deposit is refundable up to 30 days before arrival. This deposit will be applied to the total amount due, and the remaining balance is due 30 days before arrival. Guests who book less than 30 days prior to arrival the balance is due in full at the time of booking. Cancellations made 14-29 days before arrival will result in the loss of 50% of the reservation value and Cancellations made 0-13 days before arrival will result in the loss of 100% of the reservation value. Reservations must be secured with a valid credit card issued by American Express, Discover, MasterCard or Visa.  Proper validation of credit card holder identity will be required prior to arrival. Cancellations must be received in writing. Reunion Resort does not issue refunds due to acts of nature such as weather, road conditions, snow conditions, power outages or forest fires.  In the event of a rental property becoming unavailable through unforeseen damage or circumstances beyond the company’s control, Reunion Resort will seek to offer alternative accommodations.  In the event alternative accommodations cannot be secured or are unacceptable to the guest, the company will refund all monies paid to the company.  This will be the full extent of the company’s liability to the guest and the company will not be responsible for any other costs connected with any such cancellation.  Once a home has been confirmed, the reservation dates and the rental property cannot be changed.  Doing so would effectively cancel the original reservation, and the cancellation policy would apply.  Please note, no refunds will be given for late arrivals, early departures or unused days during your reservation. Is smoking allowed? While smoking or vaping is not allowed in any of the villas or vacation rental homes at Reunion®, we do have designated smoking areas on the property. Please talk with our Guest Services Team and we will be happy to assist you.  Smoking and vaping is also not allowed inside the Water Park. Are pets allowed? Pets aren't permitted in our villas and vacation homes. Certified service animals are permitted. What is Reunion® Resort's package pricing? Packages can be sent to the resort and picked up at the Reunion Grande front desk for a fee. A credit card will need to be provided at the time of picking up the package. Packages must be picked up within 30 days or they will be returned to sender. Yes, practice balls are complimentary 1 hour prior to a round of golf. What is Reunion Resort and Golf Club's raincheck policy? Are all three courses at Reunion Resort and Golf Club located at the same address? No. The Nicklaus Course has its own clubhouse and golf pro shop at 7880 Nicklaus Clubhouse Ln, Kissimmee, FL 34747. Can I book a golf tournament or event at Reunion Resort and Golf Club? Who do I contact for additional information? Yes, golf tournaments are welcomed at Reunion Resort and Golf Club. Does Reunion Resort and Golf Club have onsite dining? Yes, Reunion Resort and Golf Club is home to seven restaurants boasting both casual and fine dining. For a more casual experience both the Nicklaus Clubhouse and the Watson/Palmer Clubhouses have onsite dining available. Our restaurants are open to the public. Resort Amenities What transportation is offered within Reunion® Resort? Reunion® offers a complimentary on-resort shuttle service so that you can go anywhere on the property with ease. The shuttle operates 24 hours a day! Children must be accompanied by an adult 16 years or older to ride the shuttle. Adults must have a form of identification to verify age. Just dial 0 from your villa or if in a vacation home, call (407) 396-3180 to be picked up. What are the amenities at Reunion® Resort & Golf Club? Are any at an additional charge? Guests who book through Reunion® Resort & Golf Club (or any Reunion Preferred Rental Partners - Jeeves, Magical Vacation Homes, Rentyl, Wyndham, Worldmark and Florida Vacation Homes) have full and unlimited access to our amenities, including our Water Park, three Signature golf courses, on-resort shuttle service, tennis courts, and much more as long as the home you are staying in has amenity access. For groups larger than 12 players or to book tournaments, please email our golf group sales team at inquiries@reunionresort.com . Do we need to pay an additional fee to use the Water Park? If you book your stay with Reunion Resort or one of our Preferred Partners in a home that has amenity access, you will have access to the water park every day of your stay, included with your resort fee. Do I need a wristband to enter the Water Park? All eligible guests visiting the waterpark must have an approved wristband ( Reunion or WVO/Worldmark wristband )  that is provided to approved renters/guests at the Reunion Grande front desk (7593 Gathering Drive).   This process should be explained to you when staying within Reunion Resort if you are staying in a home/unit with amenity access.  Wristbands cannot be picked up at the waterpark. Wristbands must be worn when entering and enjoying the Waterpark and cannot be shared. Reunion Club Members can show their membership card for access to the Water park and do not need a wristband. Can you rent cabanas or umbrellas at the Water Park? Umbrellas and lawn chairs are available at the water park at no charge on a first-come, first-served basis. Please visit our Water Park page for up to date pricing. Reserve your cabana by calling the water park at 407-396-3048. Are child-sized life jackets available at the Water Park or at the resort’s pools? We do not have life jackets available at the Water park, but we do have floatation devices that can be purchased at the parent or guardian's discretion. We recommend parents bring their own swim floaties to the park. The Water Park does not have lifeguards on duty. Guests can bring their own tubes to float in the lazy river, as long as they are a reasonable size. Are pool towels available at the Water Park and at Reunion’s® pools? Pool towels are available when you check in to the Water Park. While there are no towels at the other resort pools, each villa and rental home has pool towels that you may bring to the pools. All Water park towels must be returned before leaving the water park, towels cannot leave the water park. Are all areas of the resort handicapped accessible, including pools and the water park? Reunion® Resort & Golf Club is fully compliant with the standards set forth by the Americans with Disabilities Act. If guests with wheelchairs or mobility challenges wish to use free transportation to Walt Disney World, we are happy to accommodate you. However, we ask that you call (407) 662-1000 at least 72 hours in advance to make a reservation. Are the pools heated? For your comfort, the Reunion pools (as well as the water park) are heated to approximately 80 degrees during cooler weather months. For private home pools, heat is available at a daily fee for most homes. Once the heat is turned on, it may take up to 12 hours to heat the pool. In order to heat the spa in private homes, the same fees apply as heating the pool. Please keep in mind, during cooler weather, the pool heater may not reach the desired temperature as it is subject to ambient air temperatures. What compensation is given for inclement weather? For the safety of our guests and employees, operating hours for all amenities at Reunion Resort & Golf Club are subject to change and may be adjusted without prior notice due to weather conditions or other unforeseen circumstances. Dangerous weather may include, but is not limited to, thunder and lightning, rain, high winds, hail, hurricanes, tornadoes, or extreme heat. Please note that no compensation, refunds, or credits will be provided for amenity closures or limited access resulting from inclement weather. We appreciate your understanding and cooperation. Is there a gym or fitness center at Reunion® Resort? Yes, there is a fitness center at Reunion®. Guests who book through Reunion® Resort & Golf Club may use the facility at no additional charge (included with your resort fee). Villa and Vacation Home Amenities Do all Reunion® Resort vacation home rentals and villas have kitchens? Yes, all Reunion® Resort & Golf Club accommodations are equipped with full kitchens. While you may or may not wish to cook while on vacation, the convenience of a kitchen in your villa or home will be appreciated! What Kitchen Items are Available in the Villas? Silverware Dinner Fork (8) Salad Fork (8) Dessert Spoon (8) Teaspoon (8) Dinner Knife (8) Serving Fork Serving Spoon Steak Knife (8) Dinnerware Dinner Plate (8) Salad Plate (8) Cereal Bowl (8) Mug (8) Serving Bowl (2) Round Platter Glassware Double Old Fashioned Glass (8) Iced Tea Glass (8) Wine Glass (8) Plastic Tumbler (8) Kitchen Linen Kitchen Towel (2 per Kitchen) Cookware 10" Skillet 12" Nonstick Skillet 1.5 Qt Sauce Pan with Lid 3 Qt Sauce Pan with Lid 8 Qt Stock Pot with Lid Appliances Blender - 12 speed Coffee Maker - 8 cup Toaster - 4 slice Hand Mixer - 5 speed Kitchen Accessories & Tools Casserole Dish with Lid Colander Cookie Sheet Cutting Board Knife Block Set Roasting Pan Large Salad Bowl Salad Tongs Silicone Pot Holder Mixing Bowl Ice Cream Scoop Can Opener Vegetable Peeler Corkscrew/Bottle Opener Whisk Tongs - 12" Locking Measuring Cup Set Measuring Spoon Set - 5 pc Bowl Scraper Pancake Turner Ladle Slotted Spoon Basting Spoon Do all Reunion® Resort vacation home rentals and villas have a washer and dryer? Yes, all Reunion® Resort & Golf Club accommodations are equipped with a washer and dryer either in the unit or in the building. Do all Reunion® Resort & Golf Club vacation home rentals and villas have free Wi-Fi? All villas and vacation homes booked through Reunion® Resort & Golf Club have Wi-Fi, included with your resort fee. Do you have baby items such as cribs and highchairs available for Reunion® guests? We do offer complimentary pack-n-plays for Reunion guests upon request. If you would like to request a pack-n-play for your upcoming visit, please reach out to us at 833-258-0472 or complete the Plan Your Stay form and we will note the request on your reservation. If you would prefer a full-sized crib or need other baby items, such as a highchair, we suggest that you contact Derenter at (407) 952-6222 or derenter.com . They offer delivery and pickup service. I need to book a vacation home or villa that is handicapped accessible. Do you have options for me? Yes, we do have handicapped accessible options as well as units suited to guests with hearing impairment. Please call (833) 258-0472 so that we can find accommodations that fit your needs. Reunion® Resort & Golf Club is fully compliant with the standards set forth by the Americans with Disabilities Act. Local Attractions How far is Reunion® from Orlando’s theme parks? Walt Disney World’s theme parks are 6 miles from Reunion® Resort & Golf Club. SeaWorld Orlando is 15 miles from our property and Universal Orlando is approximately 20 miles from Reunion®. There are multiple routes you can take, depending on which theme park you plan to visit. We suggest using Google Maps on your phone or GPS to determine the quickest route at the time. Do you sell tickets to theme parks and attractions at Reunion Resort? Orlando theme park, attractions, and dinner show tickets are available through our website. Purchase tickets here . Do you offer transportation to the theme parks? Reunion Resort is proud to provide free scheduled transportation from the Reunion Grande front-drive to Walt Disney World’s Transportation and Ticket Center - from there, you can access the monorail or Disney buses to reach any Disney attraction. Book Transportation Here . At this time, Reunion does not offer transportation to non-Disney theme parks such as SeaWorld Orlando and Universal Orlando. However, our onsite concierge, AGS, located in the Reunion Grande Lobby will be happy to assist you with transportation services. Concierge hours are from 8am-1pm daily. Of course, you can always utilize Uber or Lyft rideshare options from your phone. Where can I go shopping nearby? You’ll find our retail shop conveniently located inside The Grande with an excellent selection of toiletries, snacks, drinks, and souvenir apparel. Avid shoppers will also want to check out the Mall at Millenia as well as the Orlando Premium Outlets (two locations: one on Vineland Avenue, the other on International Drive). The academy is proud to provide the world’s finest instruction at a location that was hand-selected and designed by David Leadbetter himself to offer students the ultimate learning experience. Instruction Options Private Lessons & Group Clinics Discover a range of private and group lesson options covering all components of your golf game. Whether you’re seeking pointers on your full swing, putting, or chipping technique, our team of pros offers the ultimate golf instruction. Book a lesson The Golfzon Leadbetter Experience With the Golfzon Leadbetter experience, you'll find state-of-the-art video rooms, indoor/outdoor hitting bays, a biomechanics and golf performance studio, a strength, flexibility, and fitness studio, an Odyssey putting studio with SAM PuttLab technology, locker rooms, and a full-service custom club fitting and repair shop. Learn More Meet the Pros View Bio David Leadbetter Founder David Leadbetter Founder Originally from Worthing in Sussex, England, David began his career in golf on the European and South African Tours. He soon realized his interest was in the technique, mechanics, and intricacies of the game, which eventually led him to spend more time teaching than playing. David’s career took off in the mid-1980s through his documented work with Sir Nick Faldo which produced 26 Majors. Soon after David’s retirement from playing, he began to incorporate his methods and philosophies into a stringent, holistic training program for qualified instructors that remains unmatched even today. Since launching the first Leadbetter Golf Academy over 30 years ago, David has coached players to 26 Major Championship titles and over 100 individual worldwide tournament victories. Seven of those players have even held first place in the Official World Golf Ranking. With a desire to bring that same world-class instruction to players of all ages and abilities, and in addition to the numerous articles written for publications like Golf Digest and Golf International over the past three decades, David has authored eight books on the topic. Together, David’s books have sold two million copies making him one of the best-selling golf instruction authors in the world. His latest book, The A Swing, was released in May 2015 is set to transform the golf swing once again. Additionally, David has produced a number of instructional videos, DVDs, an interactive video game, and other mixed media, and developed training aids—including the SwingSetter, SwingSetter Pro and a number of A Swing approved training aids released with the book—all dedicated to helping people play better golf. Today, David remains a revered voice in golf instruction and continues to coach several top PGA, LPGA, and European Tour players, host his own satellite radio show, author new publications, develop new training aids, and continue to bring the same innovative and elite level instruction to players everywhere. View Bio Sean Hogan Master Instructor Sean Hogan Master Instructor Originally from Dublin, Ireland, Sean Hogan was a member of the Irish National Golf Team alongside major champions Darren Clarke and Padraig Harrington.  As graduate from the University South Florida in Tampa, Sean earned Academic All-American honors as a collegiate player before joining David Leadbetter and his worldwide team of instructors. As Director of Instruction at Leadbetter Golf Academies world headquarters at ChampionsGate Sean has worked alongside David with PGA and LPGA winners including Trevor Immelman, Ben Curtis, Lee Westwood, Fredrik Jacobson, Lydia Ko, and Suzann Petersen. Recognized as a Golf Magazine Top 100 and Golf Digest Best in State instructor, Sean currently enjoys working with all ages and abilities creating game improvement plans to match each players skillset and goals. View Bio Trevor Hypolite Fitness & Performance Specialist Trevor Hypolite Fitness & Performance Specialist Trevor Hypolite holds several certifications in related fields of exercise science.  Trevor has been in the fitness industry for over 18 years and has a long history within Junior Golf Academies. He has trained athletes from a wide range of sports ranging from football to golf and has trained athletes of all ages and abilities from novice, intermediate, and professional levels. Trevor is a Certified Strength and Conditioning Specialist as well as having achieved certification from the National Association of Speed & Explosion. As a biomechanics specialist, he utilizes the FMS (Functional Movement Screen) test to immediately identify the movement challenges and then incorporate a series of corrective exercises to help remedy each physical challenge. He brings a high level of knowledge, focus, and attention to detail that is essential to excelling in the field of sports performance. Combine those attributes with his work ethic and you have a dynamic team member. View Bio Nate Dougherty Senior Instructor Nate Dougherty Senior Instructor Bio Coming. View Bio Bob Lohr Senior instructor, 3-Time PGA Tour Winner Bob Lohr Senior instructor, 3-Time PGA Tour Winner A member of the PGA TOUR and PGA of America since 1985, Bob Lohr played on the PGATOUR as an exempt player for twelve consecutive years (1985-1996). A tournament winner at the 1988 Walt Disney World Oldsmobile Classic, where Bob defeated Chip Beck in an exciting five-hole playoff was certainly the highlight. Two playoff losses, one to Jay Haas in the 1993 Texas Open, the other in 1995 to Mark O’Meara at the Canadian Open are among his six runner-up finishes. He also enjoyed five 3rd place finishes during his career. Bob began working on his golf swing with David Leadbetter in November of 1989 and by the fall of 1990, defeated a field including 30 PGA TOUR tournament winners to capture the 1990 Mexican Open. He went on in 1991 to record an impressive seven top tens, including two seconds and a third. A graduate of Miami University (Ohio) where he was an Evans Scholar, Bob earned a B.S. in Marketing. An All Mid-American Conference Selection for three years and Honorable Mention All American in 1983 are among his golf accomplishments while attending Miami University. He was inducted into the Miami University Hall of Fame in 1993. Bob became an LGA Golf Instructor in 2002. He coaches players of all ages and skill levels at Champions Gate in Orlando, Florida, where he resides with his wife, Ren. View Bio Brett Meyer Senior Instructor Brett Meyer Senior Instructor Born and raised in Mendota, Illinois, and a graduate of Mendota Township High School, Brett found a career in the golf industry soon after his time at Central College in Pella, Iowa. At Central, Brett earned degrees in Marketing and Spanish. He was a member of the Ping All-Midwest Region team, served as golf team captain, had multiple All-Iowa Conference honors and played in two NCAA Division III National Championships. After college, Brett’s desire to travel and create new relationships within the golf world led him to several opportunities, including 18 months with Callaway Golf where he worked in equipment sales and club fitting. He first met David Leadbetter in 2008 and spent a year at the Leadbetter Junior Academy in Bradenton, Florida where he continued to develop his club fitting and instructional skills. Brett found success in this side of the business and became a member of LGA ChampionsGate in December of 2009 and linked LGA’s world-class golf instruction with golf equipment fitting and technology analysis such as Trackman and SAM PuttLab. A teaching career soon followed as Brett became a Leadbetter Instructor and has been the teaching assistant to David Leadbetter since 2012. He regularly works and assists with with several PGA, LPGA, and European Tour Professionals and continues to oversee the club fitting and equipment department at LGA. Brett was selected by Golf Digest as one of the Best Young Teachers in America for 2016-2017 in recognition of outstanding achievement among golf instructors under age 40. He is also Trackman Master Certified, one of few instructors nationwide with this credential. Brett is well versed with the performance staff and the Leadbetter Dynamic Golf Performance program and values his opportunities in continuing to develop through David’s counsel and from all members of LGA ChampionsGate. View Bio Chema Sanchez Senior Instructor Chema Sanchez Senior Instructor Chema Sánchez, originally from Barcelona, Spain, played golf professionally for the PGA of Spain from 2001-2003, and is still currently a member of the PGA of Spain. He was most recently awared Golf Digest’s Best Young Teachers in America list for 2018-2019. He reached the level of Master Teaching Professional by the Royal Spanish Golf Federation in 2002 and completed the LGA Instructor certification in 2003. Sánchez is also currently certified by TPI, Flightscope, and GGGA. After coming to the U.S. full time in 2008, Sánchez became a certified coach at The Gary Gilchrist Golf Academy. He reached the level of Senior Instructor in 2009, and added the role of Director of Player & Business Development for Latin America until 2015. Sánchez currently coaches elite college and junior players , including World top 50 ranked Jorge Garcia, Maria Fassi, and Karl Vilips. He also currently coaches and supports PGA TOUR and Web.com Tour players including Carlos Ortiz, Juan Sebastian Muñoz, and 2016 Olympian Rodolfo Cazaubon.  During his time assisting Gilchrist, Chema had the opportunity to work with players such as Morgan Hoffman, Peter Hanson, Charles Howell, Yani Tseng, Morgan Pressel, and Shanshan Feng. Along with being recognized as an AJGA Junior Advisor for Latin America, Sánchez is also involved in Tournament organization for the AJGA Sergio Garcia Foundation Championship. View Bio David Louys-Moroney Senior Instructor David Louys-Moroney Senior Instructor David Louys-Moroney returns to LGA ChampionsGate with nearly 20 years of experience within the coaching world, and nearly as many teaching under David Leadbetter’s philosophy. Louys-Moroney is a native of New Zealand where he began his teaching career as an assistant professional. In 2004, David began his Leadbetter Instructor certification journey and has subsequently completed re-certification in the years to follow. David has a vast teaching background teaching students all over the world including New Zealand, Australia, Slovenia, Austria, Spain, South Korea, England, Ireland, and Turkey. David took the role of Academy Director of the David Leadbetter Golf Academy in Turkey and subsequently assumed the position in South Korea where he coached four KLPGA tournament winners. One of his students, Yun Ji CHO, won the 2010 KLPGA rookie of the year. Most recently, Louys-Moroney worked with competitive juniors as a Senior Coach at IJGA before returning to his roots at LJGA. View Bio Ron Grotjan Senior Instructor Ron Grotjan Senior Instructor Originally from Normal, Illinois, Ron Grotjan began playing golf at the age of six, influenced by his father who was an accomplished player. He competed in many junior and amateur tournaments with multiple wins at the state level. He attended college at Illinois State University where he was a four-year varsity letter winner and won one college tournament. In May of 1990, Ron turned professional. While working as an Assistant Golf Professional in Illinois, Ron accumulated 23 professional victories and was also named Central Illinois Professional Golfers Association “Player of the Year” in 1991 and 1995. Through his playing years Ron attributes much of his playing success to David Leadbetter’s swing philosophies and teaching methods. Beginning in 2004, Ron felt the passion to become a golf instructor. Being familiar with the David Leadbetter System it was a perfect match. He became a Leadbetter Instructor in the spring of 2005, and now works with all ages and ability levels. See All The Pros Stay in the Loop Thank you for your interest. Reunion® Resort Water Park Reunion® Resort Water Park Sprawled across five acres of land lies the Reunion® Resort Water Park. Put on your favorite swimsuits and take on the tropical paradise for ultimate fun in the sun for the kids and complete relaxation for the parents. Zoom down the twisty water slides or jump into the zero-entry pool. Need something more laid back? Float down the tranquil lazy river or lounge by one of four waterfalls. After a dip in the water, enjoy the adjacent games like ping pong, billiards, corn hole, ladder ball, hula hoop, foosball, and giant chess. It’s just another wonderful way to enjoy the Water Park to its fullest! Enhance your Water Park experience by renting a private cabana for a day of ultimate relaxation. Please see the Water Park front desk for more details. Towels and life jackets are also available to all guests on a first-come, first-serve basis. Guests staying at homes with Reunion® Resort membership have daily access to Reunion® Resort Water Park.

For Water Park hours, please contact the Water Park front desk at (407) 396-3048.
